The javadoc for org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Combo.select() states that it will 
quietly ignore any out-of-bounds index. This is true on Windows. On LINUX 
however, an out-of-bounds index is causing the following exception to be
thrown by the select() method.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1687)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1741)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:262)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Combo.select(Combo.java:1049)
...

I should be able to work around this by simply checking the index before
attempting to call the method. Assuming that works, this is not critical.

Thanks - CB.

I'm assuming this is linux/motif. If it's linux/gtk please let us know. (You 
can distinguish between them in the "OS" field of the PR).

This is fixed in the 2.0 stream.
